channel.title: Deception: Murder in Hong Kong Rerolled - GAME END - BlueStorm and Squid win
channel.description:
# Attention Gamers, it is time to rise and grind as the Forensic Scientist needs your help. The murderer has murdered somebody and he has to somehow tell you all who the murderer is without speaking. Now all he needs is your /joins and a witness to help him and all he needs is your credit card number, a stale joke and the expiration month and year. BUT BE QUICK SO HE SHOW THE INVESTIGATORS THE MURDERER, THE EVIDENCE CARD AND THE MEANS OF MURDER CARD AND WIN THE GAME EPIC STYLE.
### Rules
https://forum.imperium42.com/t/forum-of-lies-official-hub/1515
### Gameplay (the tl;dr version) ### [Official Rulebook](https://static1.squarespace.com/static/5a3fb191cd39c31f96b9b371/t/5ad3f81388251b90ed5d9196/1523841065448/Deception+Murder+in+Hong+Kong+%28Rules%29.pdf) #### The Crime Phase
When you receive a card you will have ~24 hours to reply, confirming you have received it in your classcard. The murderer will also gain the identity of the accomplice and vice versa. Everyone except the Forensic Scientist will also gain 4 clue cards and 4 means cards upon this. The Forensics Scientist gains the identity of everyone. Upon this. The murderer must choose his means of murder and key evidence.
#### The Investigation Phase **Forensic Scientist** The Forensic Scientist must place a bullet on each scene tile that is entered into play. Even if some of these scene tiles don't have clues relevant to the case. The Scientist MUST place a bullet to one of these clues anyway. If an Investigator presents their findings for the case, this is when the Forensic Scientist may reply with "Yes" or "No" response as to if the ENTIRE CASE is correct. The Forensic Scientist and the host are the only ones who are allowed to use big text.
**Investigators** During each round, each Investigator looks at the clues the Forensic Scientist is providing and this may lead to them discussing who the murderer is. Via each phase before and after the forensic scientist place their clues There is a 24 hour time period for the players to talk about their opinions on the case.
Additionally if a player feels strongly about their findings. They may use their **/badge token** to present their case to the Forensic Scientist.
### Using Your Badge Token Once per game, every player (this includes the murderer, witness and accomplice) and present their theory of how the murder occurred in the thread. The accusation must get all three variables correct in order to solve the case. 1. The Murderer 2. The Key evidence card 3. The means of the Murder card
If any part of the theory is incorrect, the Forensic Scientist will state that the accusation was incorrect and the player who guessed it may no longer officially guess to the forensic scientist.
#### End of Game The game ends if one of the following conditions occur: * An investigator uses their Badge Token and correctly accuses. * All players have used their badge tokens with incorrect acussations/ * The third round completes without a correct accusation.
#### Who Wins? [color=steelblue]**Forensic Scientist/Investigators/Witness wincon:**[/color] If the murderer, key evidence and means of murder is correctly stated before the end of the game. They must also make sure their key witness doesn't die if this is the case.
[color=red]**Murderer/Accomplice wincons:**[/color] If nobody is able to guess correctly or if their witness kill is correctly placed.
### Rolelist: [color=navy]**Forensic Scientist**[/color] [color=red]**Murderer**[/color] [color=red]**Accomplice**[/color] [color=steelblue]**Witness**[/color] [color=steelblue]**Investigator x 6**[/color]
[details="Rolecards"] > # [color=navy]**The Forensic Scientist**[/color] :shield: > You are the forensic scientist. You know exactly what everyone's role is and you may not directly speak to the Investigators. You also know exactly what the cause of murder and and the key evidence is. *Your objective is to get the Investigators and Witness to correctly guess who the murderer is and make sure they protect the witness.*
> # [color=steelblue]**The Witness**[/color] :shield: > You are the witness, you were there to see exactly who the Murderer and Accomplice are. The two players that are associated with the crime are [x] and [y]. *Your objective is to correctly solve the case and make sure you don't die after the case is solved.*
> # [color=steelblue]**The Investigator**[/color] > You are the Investigator, you were tasked to solve the murder case. The Forensic Scientist is here to help you though. *Your objective is to correctly solve the case and make sure The Witness doesn't die after the case is solved.*
> # [color=red]**The Murderer**[/color] :shield: > You are the Murderer, which is very self explanatory. Upon your cards. You must choose which of your owned cards is the Key Evidence and the Means of Murder respectively in this DM in 12 hours upon recieving this card or it will be randomised. Once this is done, the game may officially start. > Your accomplice who helped you with your crime is [x] *Your objective is to get away with your crimes or kill the Witness.*
> # [color=red]**The Accomplice**[/color] :shield: > You are the Accomplice, you helped organise the murder with the murderer. With this, you also know the solution to the crime. > The murderer is [x] *Your objective is to get away with your crimes or kill the Witness.* [/details]
[details="Means Cards"] * Alcohol * Amoeba * Arsenic * Arson * Axe * Bamboo Tip * Bat * Belt * Bite And Tear * Blender * Blood Release * Box Cutter * Brick * Bury * Candlestick * Chainsaw * Chemicals * Cleaver * Crutch * Dagger * Dirty Water * Dismember * Drill * Drown * Dumbbell * E-Bike * Electric Baton * Electric Current * Explosives * Folding Chair * Gunpowder * Hammer * Hook * Ice Skates * Illegal Drug * Injection * Kerosene * Kick * Knife And Fork * Lighter * Liquid Drug * Locked Room * Machete * Machine * Mad Dog * Match * Mercury * Metal Chain * Metal Wire * Overdose * Packing Tape * Pesticide * Pill * Pillow * Pistol * Plague * Plastic Bag * Poisonous Gas * Poisonous Needle * Potted Plant * Powder Drug * Punch * Push * Radiation * Razor Blade * Rope * Scarf * Scissors * Sculpture * Smoke * Sniper * Starvation * Steel Tube * Stone * Sulfuric Acid * Surgery * Throat Slit * Towel * Trophy * Trowel * Unarmed * Venomous Scorpion * Venomous Snake * Video Game Console * Virus * Whip * Wine * Wire * Work * Wrench [/details]
[details="Clue Cards"] * Air Conditioning * Ants * Antique * Apple * Badge * Bandage * Banknote * Bell * Betting Chips * Blood * Bone * Book * Bracelet * Bread * Briefs * Broom * Bullet * Button * Cake * Calender * Candy * Carton * Cassette Tape * Cat * Certificate * Chalk * Cigar * Cigarette Ash * Cigarette Butt * Cleaning Cloth * Cockroach * Coffee * Coins * Comics * Computer * Computer Disk * Computer Mouse * Confidential Letter * Cosmetic Mask * Cotton * Cup * Curtains * Dentures * Diamond * Diary * Dice * Dictionary * Dirt * Documents * Dog Fur * Dust * Earrings * Eggs * Electric Circuit * Envelope * Exam Paper * Express Courier * Fan * Fax * Fiber Optics * Fingernails * Flashlight * Flip-Flop * Flute * Flyer * Food Ingredients * Gear * Gift * Gloves * Glue * Graffiti * Hair * Hairpin * Handcuffs * Hanger * Hat * Headset * Helmet * Herbal Medicine * High Heel * Hourglass * Ice * ID Card * Ink * Insect * Internet Cable * Invitation Card * IOU Note * Iron * IV Bag * Jacket * Jewelry * Juice * Key * Leaf * Leather Bag * Leather Shoe * Lens * Light Bulb * Lipstick * Lock * Lottery Ticket * Love Letter * Luggage * Lunch Box * Magazine * Mahjong Tiles * Map * Mark * Mask * Maze * Menu * Mirror * Mobile Phone * Model * Mosquito * Mosquito Coil * Nail * Name Card * Necklace * Needle And Thread * Newspaper * Note * Notebook * Numbers * Office Supplies * Oil Painting * Oil Stain * Paint * Panties * Peanut * Perfume * Photograph * Plant * Plastic * Playing Cards * Pocket Watch * Postal Stamp * Powder * Prescription * Puppet * Push Pin * Puzzle * Raincoat * Rat * Receipt * Red Wine * Riddle * Ring * Rose * Rubber Stamp * Sack * Safety Pin * Sand * Sawdust * Seasoning * Signature * Skull * Snacks * Soap * Sock * Soft Drink * Speaker * Specimen * Spider * Spinning Top * Sponge * Spring * Steamed Buns * Stockings * Stuffed Toy * Suit * Sunglasses * Surgical Mask * Surveillance Camera * Switch * Syringe * Table Lamp * Take-Out * Tattoo * Tea Leaves * Telephone * Test Tube * Tie * Timber * Tissue * Tool Box * Toothpicks * Toy * Toy Blocks * Tweezers * Umbrella * Uniform * USB Flash Drive * Vegetables * Video Camera * Violin * Wallet * Watch * Wig [/details]
[details="Event Tiles"] |Cause of Death|Marker Placement| |---|---| |Suffocation| |Severe Injury| |Loss of Blood| |Illness/Diseases| |Poisoning| |Accident|
|Duration of Crime|Marker Placement| |---|---| |Instanteous| |Brief| |Periodically| |Prolonged| |Few Days| |Unclear|
|General Impression|Marker Placement| |---|---| |Common| |Creative| |Fishy| |Cruel| |Horrible| |Suspenseful|
|In Progress |Marker Placement| |---|---| |Entertainment| |Subdued| |Assembly| |Trading| |Visit| |Dining|
|Motive of Crime|Marker Placement| |---|---| |Hatred| |Power| |Money| |Love| |Jealousy| |Justice|
|Source of Message|Marker Placement| |---|---| |Sound| |Action| |Smell| |Image| |Touch| |Others|
|Victim's Identity|Marker Placement| |---|---| |Child| |Young Adult| |Middle-Aged| |Senior| |Male| |Female| [/details]
### Players: #### [color=darkred]Guessed Incorrectly[/color] 1. **Mislynched Marl - [color=navy]Forensic Scientist[/color]** 1. [color=darkred]**BlueStorm - Geyde, Bury, High Heels**[/color] 2. **[color=darkred]**Geyde - Blue, Chemicals, Sand**[/color] 3. **[color=darkred]Livicus - Blue, Chemicals, Cosmetic Mask[/color]** 4. **[color=darkred]Max - Blue, Chemicals, Leather Bag[/color]** 5. **[color=darkred]Squiddums - Blue, Crutch, Leather Bag[/color]** 6. **Mark** 8. **[color=darkred]Margaret - Luxy, Cake, Metal Wire[/color]** 9. **[color=darkred]Luxy - Blue, Chemicals, Stocking[/color]** 10. [color=darkred]**~~Furry Trash~~ Insanity Margaret Mercury, Test tube**[/color]
### Spectatoes :potato: :
### Backups: 1. **GamerPoke**monKidRyan
### Timestamps: [Game Start, Everyone's Cards](https://forum.imperium42.com/t/deception-murder-in-hong-kong-rerolled-10-10-pregame/74153/7?u=pug) [Round 1 - Victim's Identity](https://forum.imperium42.com/t/deception-murder-in-hong-kong-rerolled-10-10-pregame/74153/8?u=pug) [Round 2 - In Progress](https://forum.imperium42.com/t/deception-murder-in-hong-kong-rerolled-10-10-round-1/74153/156?u=pug) [https://forum.imperium42.com/t/deception-murder-in-hong-kong-rerolled-round-2/74153/238?u=pug](http://Round 3 - General Impression)
### Event Card Marker Locations **R1: Victim's Identity** - Female **R2: In Progress** - Subdued **R3 - General Impression** - Cruel

item.title: Deception: Murder in Hong Kong Rerolled - GAME END - BlueStorm and Squid win
item.dc:creator: Marluxion
item.description:
Female -

First of all, BlueStorm has the most female related Items.
Secondly, the clue was the stocking, inherently female.

Cruel -

There’s no good way to explain a murder with a towel except cruel. The ONLY way that i can think of to kill someone with a towel is via strangulation which is incredibly painful and slow. Hence, cruel.

Subdued

https://i.imgur.com/2C32SyM.png

Read full topic
